Method Detail

generateDocument

public void generateDocument()
                      throws intradoc.common.ServiceException,
                             java.lang.Exception
Method for generating a new Stellent document from a template stored in Stellent.

Called either via IdcService GENERATE_DOC_FROM_TEMPLATE or can be embedded as a JavaMethod in a SERVICE or SUB Service. When successful it adds the field newDocumentId to the Stellent binder with the dDocName of the newly created document.

When invoked the binder must have a templateId which is the dDocName of the document which will be used as a template for generating the new document. The binder should also include the mandatory fields dDocTitle, dDocType and dSecurityGroup which will be automatically assigned to the newly created document.
Normally the binder should also include a metadataInContent field which is a comma separated list of metadata names which will be searched and replaced within the template content. The metadata values used to replace the names must be included in the binder as name/value pairs. In addition the metadataFields parameter is a comma separated list of metadata names whose values should be set on the new documents metadata fields. Again these name/value pairs should be included in the binder.

For example if the binder contains this:
templateId=DOC_TEMPLATE
metadataInContent=dDocTitle,xComments
metadataFields=xComments
dDocTitle=NEW DOC NAME
xComments=Hello there
dSecurityGroup=Public
dDocType=Document

 The new document content will have replaced any instances of dDocTitle and xComments in the content with 'NEW DOC NAME' and 'Hello there'. In addition the new document will have the standard metadata fields, dDocTitle, dSecurityGroup and dDocType set plus xComments will be set to 'Hello there' (because it is included in the metadataFields list).

Throws:
intradoc.common.ServiceException
java.lang.Exception

setGenerateUser

public void setGenerateUser(java.lang.String userName)
Specify the user who should generate the new document. The user should be a valid Oracle UCM user. If not set the document will be generated by the sysadmin account.

Parameters:
userName -

setMetadataValues

public void setMetadataValues(java.util.Hashtable h)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
Set a hashtable of name/value metadata pairs which should be applied to the new document. The Hashtable must as a minimum include a dDocTitle, dDocType, and dSecurityGroup.

Parameters:
h -
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

setContentValues

public void setContentValues(java.util.Hashtable h)
set a hashtable of name/value pairs to search and replace in the new document content. Passed names will be checked against the raw template content. DocGenerator will look for the byte sequence specified by StringUtils.TAG_PREFIX/StringUtils.TAG_SUFFIX and then lookup any words within the tags and check them against this Hashtable.

Parameters:
h -

generateFileNameFromTitle

public void generateFileNameFromTitle()
Call this method so that the generated document Original filename is set to the passed dDocTitle (reformatted so that it is filename safe).

create

public java.util.Vector create()
                        throws java.lang.Exception
Method for creating a new document from template. It returns the dDocName, dExtension, dID, dOriginalName and dDocTitle of the newly created document in a Vector.

Returns:
Vector
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
